exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approved_at

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

approved_by

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

publisher_id
role

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

subscribed_journalists

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

subscribed_publishers

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id
class archive.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents a publishing company or organization.

name

The unique name of the publisher.

Type:

CharField

description

Optional description of the publisher.

Type:

TextField

editors

Users with editing permissions for the publisher.

Type:

ManyToManyField

journalists

Users associated as journalists for the publisher.

Type:

ManyToManyField

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
profiles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class archive.forms.ArticleForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Form for creating and updating Article instances.

Meta:

model (Article): The model this form is based on. fields (list): The fields to include in the form (‘title’ and ‘content’).

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class archive.forms.NewsletterForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Form for creating and updating Newsletter instances.

Meta:

model (Newsletter): The model this form is based on. fields (list): The fields to include in the form (‘title’ and ‘content’).

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class archive.forms.RegistrationForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Registration form to use

clean()

Hook for doing any extra form-wide cleaning after Field.clean() has been called on every field. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field named ‘__all__’.

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

save(commit=True)

Save this form’s self.instance object if commit=True. Otherwise, add a save_m2m() method to the form which can be called after the instance is saved manually at a later time. Return the model instance.

archive.views.approve_article(request, article_id)

Approves a submitted article.

archive.views.approve_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)

Approves a submitted newsletter.

archive.views.article_detail(request, article_id)

Displays the content of a single article. Editors can view submitted/approved articles, while other users can only view published ones.

archive.views.articles_by_journalist(request, username)

Displays published articles and newsletters by a specific journalist.

archive.views.create_article(request)

Allows a contributor to create a new article.

archive.views.create_newsletter(request)

Allows a contributor to create a new newsletter.

archive.views.delete_article(request, article_id)

Allows a contributor to delete their own article if it hasn’t been approved yet.

archive.views.delete_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)

Allows a contributor to delete their own newsletter if it hasn’t been approved yet.

archive.views.edit_article(request, article_id)

Allows a contributor to edit their own article if it hasn’t been approved yet.

archive.views.edit_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)

Allows a contributor to edit their own newsletter if it hasn’t been approved yet.

archive.views.editor_dashboard(request)

Renders the editor dashboard with submitted and approved articles and newsletters.

archive.views.is_contributor_check(user)

Checks if a user is in the ‘Journalist’ or ‘Editor’ group.

archive.views.is_editor_check(user)

Checks if a user is in the ‘Editor’ group.

archive.views.journalists_list(request)

Displays a list of all journalists.

archive.views.login_user(request)

Handles user login.

archive.views.logout_user(request)

Handles user logout.

archive.views.my_submissions(request)

Displays a contributor’s submitted articles and newsletters.

archive.views.my_subscriptions_view(request)

Displays a list of all publishers and journalists the user is subscribed to.

archive.views.newsletter_detail(request, newsletter_id)

Displays the content of a single published newsletter.

archive.views.publish_article(request, article_id)

Publishes an approved article.

archive.views.publish_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)

Publishes an approved newsletter.

archive.views.publisher_detail(request, pk)

Displays the details of a single publisher.

archive.views.publishers_list(request)

Displays a list of all publishers (from the Publisher model).

archive.views.register(request)

Handles user registration and assigns new users to the correct group and publisher.

archive.views.reject_article(request, article_id)

Rejects a submitted article.

archive.views.reject_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)

Rejects a submitted newsletter.

archive.views.safe_get_group(name)

Helper to safely get or create a group by name.

archive.views.subscribe_to_journalist(request, pk)

Allows a logged-in user to subscribe to a journalist.

archive.views.subscribe_to_publisher(request, pk)

Allows a logged-in user to subscribe to a publisher.

archive.views.unsubscribe_from_journalist(request, pk)

Allows a logged-in user to unsubscribe from a journalist.

archive.views.unsubscribe_from_publisher(request, pk)

Allows a logged-in user to unsubscribe from a publisher.

archive.views.welcome_view(request)

Render the welcome page with published articles, newsletters, journalists, and publishers.

The view collects published articles and newsletters, combines them into a single list ordered by publication date, and fetches all journalists and publishers to display on the welcome page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

Rendered ‘welcome.html’ template with context data.

Return type:

HttpResponse
